title: Kled should be a champion I enjoy, but he isn't
body:
but why not? he's aggressive, he has good BM, and he does a lot of damage -- that's 3 of my top qualities right there

i can't figure out why he doesn't click, has anyone else who plays Kled now had the same issue with him before?

replies.body: He's too fast paced for me honestly.
Lol I am in the exact same boat as you.  I feel like I should love playing that champ and enjoy it based on his kit...but it just never worked that way.
it's so frustrating, I want to like him because I like the character, but I just can't enjoy playing him for some reason. there must be some barrier to him being fun that I haven't discovered yet

I do not play him, so you can ignore me, but could it deal with the apparent tankiness that he is suppose to have clashing with damage?

With Scaarl, you cannot say that building tank is not a good option, yet you want damage. Going Titanic Hydra is possible, yes, but aside from that, there are few options that increases the damage you want him to have with the tankiness he should be.

Does that make any sense? I am just throwing this out there. An issue I had when I first tried him.
I think its the lack of control on the W

He has a global dash for his team, 2 MORE long range dashes as if that wasnt enough, Thresh Q, and enough damage to 100-0 anyone with 1 skill. Oh and he has 150% the hp of anyone in the game for free. What else do you want?
No, I love kled and I've been using him to climb YOLO queue. Have you tried building him with crit yet? Because I assure you, while not exactly viable, it's amazing.

mostly I've been experimenting with heavy AD/lifesteal builds like {{item:3071}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3812}} or something similar

haven't really come across a build that feels like one I'd want to use consistently though, i'm not fond of the titanic tank builds either

It's all matchup based. If you need to survive burst and remount, then going Death's Dance is a good place to start. Against something tanky? Black cleaver. Sometimes you want burst and waveclear, so you rush Tiamat. BoRK is good when you'll need to help take down high-hp targets.

You can build anything as Kled, I swear, but the right tools are based on the enemy comp. Personally, I only take one lifesteal item, and often end up with something that looks like {{item:3071}}, {{item:3748}}, {{item:3812}}, {{item:3053}}, {{item:3046}}, and your choice of boots.
I play him from time to time to see the salt in chat from people who think he's op, its funny to respond with one of his quotes and watch them get angry
